properties.areaDesc: Madison; Haywood; Graham; Mitchell; Swain; Avery; Yancey
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 4 at 10:44AM EST until January 5 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
...SNOWY AND WINDY CONDITIONS TO DEVELOP THROUGH TONIGHT ACROSS
THE NORTH CAROLINA MOUNTAINS...

.Colder air infiltrating in behind a cold front this afternoon
combined with lingering moisture in northwest flow will allow for
rain showers to transition to snow showers beginning this afternoon
for areas in North Carolina along the Tennessee border. Snowfall
amounts will be highest across the higher elevations and along the
border. Gusty northwest winds combined with falling snow may reduce
visibilities at times.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Snow accumulations of up to an inch is
possible across the mountain valleys, with up to 4 inches
across elevations of 3500 ft. 3 to 5 inches will be possible
in and around Mount Mitchell. Higher amounts of 6 to 8 inches
will be possible across the higher elevations in Swain and
Haywood counties. Northwest wind gusts will be as high as 50
mph.

* WHERE...Portions of western North Carolina, especially along
the Tennessee border.

* WHEN...From noon today to 7 AM EST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Gusty winds could
bring down tree branches. Gusty winds and falling snow could
reduce visibilities.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Please report snow and ice accumulations by calling the National
Weather Service toll free at...1...800...2 6 7...8 1 0 1. Leave a
message with your observation and the specific location where it
occurred. You can also post your report to National Weather
Service Greenville Spartanburg Facebook or tweet your report
using hashtag nwsgsp.

Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or your favorite source of
weather information for the latest updates. Additional details
can be found at www.weather.gov/gsp.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST SUNDAY
